Class Reception

java.lang.Object
hospital.usermanagment.User
hospital.usermanagment.Reception
public class Reception extends User
Represents a Receptionist in the hospital management system. Provides functionality for managing patient registration, appointment scheduling, billing, and interacting with doctors.

  • Constructor Details

    • Reception

      public Reception(int userID, String password, String role, String name, String email, String contactNumber, AppointmentManager appointmentManager, Map<String,Doctor> doctors, Inventory inventory)
      Constructor for Receptionist.
      Parameters:
      userID - The unique user ID.
      password - The password.
      role - The role (should be "Receptionist").
      name - The receptionist's name.
      email - The receptionist's email.
      contactNumber - The receptionist's contact number.
      appointmentManager - The AppointmentManager instance.
      doctors - A map of doctors, with their IDs as keys.
      inventory - The inventory object for managing medicines.

  • Method Details

    • generateBill

      public void generateBill(int patientID, String appointmentID)
      Generates a bill for a patient's appointment, updates the appointment record, and stores the invoice.
      Parameters:
      patientID - The patient's ID.
      appointmentID - The appointment's ID.

    • createPatient

      public Patient createPatient()
      Creates or retrieves an existing patient. If the user ID is new, prompts for registration.
      Returns:
      A `Patient` object representing the patient.

    • registerNewPatient

      public Patient registerNewPatient()
      Registers a new patient by prompting for their details and adding them to the patient file.
      Returns:
      A `Patient` object representing the newly registered patient.

    • isValidEmail

      private boolean isValidEmail(String email)
      Validates if the given email has a valid format.
      Parameters:
      email - The email to validate.
      Returns:
      True if the email is valid, false otherwise.

    • isValidBloodGroup

      private boolean isValidBloodGroup(String bloodGroup)
      Validates if the given blood group is valid.
      Parameters:
      bloodGroup - The blood group to validate.
      Returns:
      True if the blood group is valid, false otherwise.

    • loginExistingPatient

      public Patient loginExistingPatient(int userID)
      Logs in an existing patient by validating their credentials.
      Parameters:
      userID - The patient's user ID.
      Returns:
      A `Patient` object if login is successful, null otherwise.

    • patientExists

      public boolean patientExists(int userID)
      Checks if a patient exists in the file based on their user ID.
      Parameters:
      userID - The patient's user ID.
      Returns:
      True if the patient exists, false otherwise.

    • authenticatePatient

      private boolean authenticatePatient(int patientID, String password)
      Authenticates a patient based on their user ID and password.
      Parameters:
      patientID - The patient's user ID.
      password - The password to validate.
      Returns:
      True if authentication is successful, false otherwise.

    • addNewPatientToFile

      private void addNewPatientToFile(int userID, String password, String name, String dob, String gender, String email, String contact, String bloodGroup)
      Adds a new patient's details to the patient file.
      Parameters:
      userID - The unique user ID.
      password - The patient's password.
      name - The patient's name.
      dob - The patient's date of birth.
      gender - The patient's gender.
      email - The patient's email.
      contact - The patient's contact number.
      bloodGroup - The patient's blood group.

    • viewAvailableSlots

      public void viewAvailableSlots(LocalDate date)
      Views available appointment slots for a specific doctor on a given date.
      Parameters:
      date - The date for which to view available slots.

    • scheduleAppointment

      public void scheduleAppointment(Patient patient, String doctorID, LocalDate date, LocalTime startTime)
      Schedules an appointment for a patient with a specified doctor, date, and time.
      Parameters:
      patient - The patient object.
      doctorID - The doctor's ID.
      date - The date of the appointment.
      startTime - The start time of the appointment.
